pli-tv-kd13:32.1.26.eng: The group of four hundred on simultaneous probation with being sent back to the beginning is finished.

pli-tv-kd13:33.1.0.eng: 7. The group of eight sections on “specified”, etc.

pli-tv-kd13:33.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjitvā parimāṇā appaṭicchādetvā …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:33.1.1.eng: “It may be that a monk commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified …

pli-tv-kd13:33.1.3.eng: unconcealed and having the same name …

pli-tv-kd13:33.1.5.eng: unconcealed and of the same kind …

pli-tv-kd13:33.1.7.eng: unconcealed and of the same sort …

pli-tv-kd13:33.1.8.eng: unconcealed and of different sorts and then disrobes. …
pli-tv-kd13:33.1.8.comm: “Of the same sort” renders vavatthitā, while “of different sorts” renders sambhinnā. Sp 4.180: Vavatthitā sambhinnāti sabhāgavisabhāgānamevetaṁ pariyāyavacanaṁ, “‘Of the same sort’ and ‘of different sorts’ are synonymous with ‘of the same kind’ and ‘of different kinds’.”

pli-tv-kd13:33.1.10.eng: The group of eight sections on “specified”, etc., is finished.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.0.eng: 8. The group of eleven sections on two monks

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.1.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.2.eng: and they regard it as such.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.3.eng: One conceals his offense, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.4.eng: The one who conceals it is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.5.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.5.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.6.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.7.eng: but they are unsure of it.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.8.eng: One conceals his offense, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.9.eng: The one who conceals it is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.10.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.10.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.11.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.12.eng: but they regard it as mixed with other offenses.
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.12.comm: Missakadiṭṭhino, literally, “They see (it) as mixed.” Sp 4.181: Tattha missakanti thullaccayādīhi missakaṁ, “Therein ‘mixed’ means mixed with serious offenses, etc.”

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.13.eng: One conceals his offense, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.14.eng: The one who conceals it is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.15.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.15.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.16.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension mixed with other offenses,
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.16.comm: The Pali just says missaka, “mixed”, without specifying the offenses. However, since both probation and the trial period are mentioned further down, it is clear that an offense entailing suspension is included.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.17.eng: but they regard them as an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.18.eng: One conceals his offenses, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.19.eng: The one who conceals them is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.20.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.20.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.21.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension mixed with other offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.22.eng: and they regard them as such.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.23.eng: One conceals his offenses, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.24.eng: The one who conceals them is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.25.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.25.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.26.eng: Two monks have each committed a light offense,
pli-tv-kd13:34.1.26.comm: Sp 4.181: Suddhakanti saṅghādisesaṁ vinā lahukāpattikkhandhameva, “Suddhaka: just belonging to the group of light offenses without an offense entailing suspension.”

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.27.eng: but they regard it as an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.28.eng: One conceals his offense, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.29.eng: The one who conceals it is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.30.eng: Both are then to be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.31.eng: Two monks have each committed a light offense,

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.32.eng: and they regard it as such.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.33.eng: One conceals his offense, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.34.eng: The one who conceals it is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.1.35.eng: Both are then to be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.1.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.2.eng: and they regard it as such.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.3.pli: Ekassa hoti ārocessāmīti, ekassa hoti na ārocessāmīti.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.3.eng: One thinks, “I’ll inform,” while the other thinks, “I won’t inform.”

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.4.pli: So paṭhamampi yāmaṃ chādeti, dutiyampi yāmaṃ chādeti, tatiyampi yāmaṃ chādeti—
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.4.eng: He then conceals it during the first part of the night, during the second part of the night, and during the third part of the night.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.5.eng: If he’s still concealing it at dawn, he has committed an offense

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.6.eng: and is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.7.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.7.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.8.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.9.eng: and they regard it as such.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.11.pli: Ekassa antarāmagge makkhadhammo uppajjati na ārocessāmīti.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.11.eng: On their way, one of them decides to conceal it, thinking, “I won’t inform.”
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.11.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.181: Makkhadhammo nāma chādetukāmatā, “Makkhadhammo: desiring to cover over.”

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.12.pli: So paṭhamampi yāmaṃ chādeti, dutiyampi yāmaṃ chādeti, tatiyampi yāmaṃ chādeti—
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.12.eng: He then conceals it during the first part of the night, during the second part of the night, and during the third part of the night.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.13.eng: If he’s still concealing it at dawn, he has committed an offense

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.14.eng: and is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.15.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.15.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.16.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.17.eng: and they regard it as such.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.18.comm: Although the Pali uses the present tense, the insanity must be subsequent to the committing of the offense. Otherwise there would be no offense.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.19.pli: Te pacchā anummattakā hutvā eko chādeti, eko nacchādeti.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.19.eng: When they regain their sanity, one conceals his offense, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.20.eng: The one who conceals it is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.21.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.21.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.22.eng: Two monks have each committed an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.23.eng: During the recitation of the Monastic Code, they say,

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.25.pli: ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.25.eng: that this rule too has come down in the Monastic Code, is included in the Monastic Code, and comes up for recitation every half-month.”

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.26.eng: They regard it as an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.27.eng: One conceals his offense, but not the other.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.28.eng: The one who conceals it is to confess an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.29.pli: Yathāpaṭicchanne cassa parivāsaṃ datvā ubhinnampi mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:34.2.29.eng: He should be given probation according to the length of that concealment, and both should then be given the trial period.

pli-tv-kd13:34.2.30.eng: The group of eleven sections on two monks is finished.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.0.eng: 9. The group of nine on unpurified with sending back to the beginning

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.1.eng: “It may be, monks, that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.2.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.2.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.3.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.4.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.4.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.5.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.6.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.6.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation legitimately,
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.6.comm: It is not clear from the Pali whether the sending back to the beginning and the giving of simultaneous probation are supposed to happen in one and the same legal procedure or in two different ones. It would seem, however, that either way would be acceptable, so long as the procedure is phrased appropriately. For the rendering “irreversible” for akuppa, see kuppa in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.7.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.8.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.8.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.9.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.9.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.10.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.10.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.11.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.12.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo paṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.12.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, concealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.13.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.14.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.14.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation legitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.15.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.16.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.16.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.17.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.17.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.18.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.18.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.19.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.20.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.20.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both concealed and unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.21.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.22.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti, adhammena mānattaṃ deti, adhammena abbheti.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.22.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation legitimately, but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.23.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.23.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.1.eng: “It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.2.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.2.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.3.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.4.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati aparimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.4.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and unspecified …

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.6.eng: both concealed and unconcealed and unspecified …

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.7.eng: unconcealed and both specified and unspecified.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.8.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.9.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.9.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation legitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.10.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.11.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.11.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.12.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.12.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.13.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.13.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.14.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.15.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.15.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, concealed and both specified and unspecified.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.16.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.17.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.17.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation legitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.18.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.19.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.19.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.20.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.20.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.21.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.21.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.22.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.23.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.23.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both concealed and unconcealed and both specified and unspecified.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.24.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.25.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena;
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.25.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand.

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.26.eng: The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation legitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.27.eng: but then gives him the trial period

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.29.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:35.2.29.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.”

pli-tv-kd13:35.2.30.eng: The group of nine on unpurified with sending back to the beginning is finished.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.1.eng: “It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.2.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.3.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.3.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.4.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti, so parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā appaṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.4.eng: which he gets. While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.5.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.6.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.6.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.7.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.8.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.8.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.9.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.9.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.10.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.11.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.11.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.12.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.13.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.13.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, concealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.14.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.15.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.15.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.16.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.17.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.17.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.18.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.18.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.19.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.20.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.20.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.21.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.22.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.22.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both concealed and unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.23.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.24.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.24.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.25.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.26.pli: So bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.26.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.27.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi, ekanāmampi nānānāmampi, sabhāgampi visabhāgampi, vavatthitampi sambhinnampi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.27.eng: “It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds, both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.28.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.28.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.29.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.30.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati aparimāṇā appaṭicchannāyo …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.30.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and unspecified …

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.32.eng: both concealed and unconcealed and unspecified …

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.33.eng: unconcealed and both specified and unspecified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.34.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.35.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.35.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.36.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.37.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.37.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.38.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.38.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.39.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.40.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.40.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.41.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.42.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.42.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, concealed and both specified and unspecified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.43.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.44.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti, dhammena mānattaṃ deti, dhammena abbheti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.44.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately, but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.45.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.45.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.46.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.46.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.47.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.48.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.48.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.49.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.50.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyopi aparimāṇāyopi paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.50.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both concealed and unconcealed and both specified and unspecified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.51.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.52.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.52.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately,

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.53.eng: but then gives him the trial period and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.54.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu avisuddho tāhi āpattīhi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.1.54.eng: He’s not purified of those offenses.”

pli-tv-kd13:36.1.55.eng: The second group of nine is finished.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.1.eng: “It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.2.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.3.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.3.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.4.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.5.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.5.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.6.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.7.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.7.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.8.pli: So parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.8.eng: Thinking that he’s on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.9.pli: So tasmiṃ bhūmiyaṃ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarati, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.9.eng: At this point, he remembers offenses committed while on probation for the former offenses, and he remembers offenses committed while on probation for the further offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.11.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.13.pli: Sohaṃ saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yāciṃ.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.14.pli: Tassa me saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.15.pli: Sohaṃ parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.17.pli: Taṃ maṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassi adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.18.pli: Sohaṃ parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇāyo appaṭicchannāyo.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.19.pli: Sohaṃ tasmiṃ bhūmiyaṃ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.20.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ saṅghaṃ purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ yāceyyaṃ dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ;
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.20.eng: and thinks, ‘Let me ask the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for all those offenses. The procedure must be legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The simultaneous probation,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.21.eng: the trial period, and the rehabilitation must all be legitimate.’

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.22.pli: So saṅghaṃ purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ yācati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ;
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.22.eng: He asks the Sangha to be sent back to the beginning in this way,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.24.pli: Taṃ saṅgho purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.24.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.25.eng: the trial period, and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.26.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu visuddho tāhi āpattīhi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.27.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.27.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.28.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.29.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.29.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.30.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.31.pli: So parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.31.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, concealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.32.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.33.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati, adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.33.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.34.pli: So parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.34.eng: Thinking that he’s on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, concealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.35.pli: So tasmiṃ bhūmiyaṃ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarati, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.35.eng: At this point he remembers offenses committed while on probation for the former offenses, and he remembers offenses committed while on probation for the further offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.37.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.39.pli: Sohaṃ saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yāciṃ.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.40.pli: Tassa me saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.41.pli: Sohaṃ parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.43.pli: Taṃ maṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassi, adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.44.pli: Sohaṃ parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇā paṭicchannāyo.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.45.pli: Sohaṃ tasmiṃ bhūmiyaṃ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.46.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ saṅghaṃ purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ yāceyyaṃ dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ, dhammena mānattaṃ, dhammena abbhānan’ti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.46.eng: and thinks, ‘Let me ask the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for all those offenses. The procedure must be legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The simultaneous probation, the trial period, and the rehabilitation must all be legitimate.’

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.47.pli: So saṅghaṃ purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ yācati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ, dhammena mānattaṃ, dhammena abbhānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.47.eng: He asks the Sangha to be sent back to the beginning in this way,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.48.pli: Taṃ saṅgho purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti, dhammena mānattaṃ deti, dhammena abbheti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.48.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation, the trial period, and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.49.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu visuddho tāhi āpattīhi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.50.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.50.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both having the same name and having different names, both of the same kind and of different kinds,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.51.eng: both of the same sort and of different sorts.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.52.pli: So saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.52.eng: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.53.pli: Tassa saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.54.eng: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both concealed and unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.55.eng: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.56.pli: Taṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassati adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.56.eng: which it does. But the legal procedure is illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation illegitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.57.pli: So parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.57.eng: Thinking that he’s on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension, both concealed and unconcealed and specified.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.58.pli: So tasmiṃ bhūmiyaṃ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarati, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarati.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.58.eng: At this point he remembers offenses committed while on probation for the former offenses, and he remembers offenses committed while on probation for the further offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.60.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.62.pli: Sohaṃ saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ yāciṃ.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.63.pli: Tassa me saṅgho tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ samodhānaparivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.64.pli: Sohaṃ parivasanto antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇā paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.66.pli: Taṃ maṃ saṅgho antarāāpattīnaṃ mūlāya paṭikassi adhammikena kammena kuppena aṭṭhānārahena, adhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.67.pli: Sohaṃ parivasāmīti maññamāno antarā sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjiṃ parimāṇā paṭicchannāyopi appaṭicchannāyopi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.68.pli: Sohaṃ tasmiṃ bhūmiyaṃ ṭhito purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattiyo sarāmi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.69.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ saṅghaṃ purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ yāceyyaṃ dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ, dhammena mānattaṃ, dhammena abbhānan’ti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.69.eng: and thinks, ‘Let me ask the Sangha to send me back to the beginning for all those offenses. The procedure must be legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The simultaneous probation, the trial period, and the rehabilitation must all be legitimate.’

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.70.pli: So saṅghaṃ purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ yācati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ, dhammena mānattaṃ, dhammena abbhānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.70.eng: He asks the Sangha to be sent back to the beginning in this way,

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.71.pli: Taṃ saṅgho purimāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, aparāāpattīnaṃ antarāāpattīnañca, mūlāya paṭikassati dhammikena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena, dhammena samodhānaparivāsaṃ deti, dhammena mānattaṃ deti, dhammena abbheti.
pli-tv-kd13:36.2.71.eng: which it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. The Sangha gives him the simultaneous probation legitimately, the trial period, and the rehabilitation legitimately.

pli-tv-kd13:36.2.72.pli: So, bhikkhave, bhikkhu visuddho tāhi āpattīhi.

pli-tv-kd13:36.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampi aparimāṇampi …pe…

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.55.comm: I read mukhaṁ as referring to the fact that this section is headed by, or starts with, “specified” offenses but then moves on to other kinds of offenses.

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.57.eng: And just the same for unsure.

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.59.comm: Reading asuddhake va diṭṭhino with SRT.

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.60.eng: And both see it as light.

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.62.eng: And then with the thought of concealing;

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.63.eng: And one who is insane, confession,

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.64.eng: To the beginning, eighteen as to purity.

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.66.eng: Who are the inspiration of Sri Lanka,

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.67.eng: The residents of the Mahāvihāra monastery—

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.68.eng: These were their words for the longevity of the true Teachings.”

pli-tv-kd13:36.4.69.eng: The gathering up chapter is finished.
